post.description: Create Chat Completion on a specified text generation model.
Create Chat Completion on a specified text generation model with retrieval-augmented generation, utilizing the context of relevant search results from items or files in a vectore store collection.
Generates speech audio from input text.

get.description: Get a list of voices for speech generation.
Retrieve a list of vector store collections.

post.description: Creates a vector store collection for searchable embeddings.

get.description: Retrieve a vector store collection by the ID.

patch.description: Updates a vector store collection record.

delete.description: Deletes a vector store collection record. This will also remove all items in the collection.

post.description: Searches items in a vector store collection for the closest embeddings matches.

get.description: Retrieve a list of items within a vector store collections.

post.description: Adds an item to a vector store collection.

get.description: Retrieve a vector store collection item by the ID.

patch.description: Updates a vector store collection item record.

delete.description: Deletes a vector store collection item record.

get.description: Retrieve a list of files within a vector store collections.

post.description: Adds a file to a vector store collection.

file.description: The file object to be uploaded to the vector store collection.

get.description: Retrieve a vector store collection file by the ID.

delete.description: Deletes a vector store collection file record.

post.description: Creates an image given a prompt.

get.description: Retrieve a list of inference models.
Retrieve a list of models for speech and audio inference.
Retrieve a list of models for image gneration.
View usage information for the current and previous months.

post.description: Look up requests sent to the Vultr Inference API along with their response details.

get.description: View the current status of the inference cluster.

model.description: The [model](#operation/list-models) that will be inferred for chat completion.

messages.description: The message context to use for the chat completion request, separated by system, user, and assistant roles.

stream.description: Indicates whether the response should be streamed.

max_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate for the chat completion.

n.description: The number of chat completion choices to generate for each input message.

seed.description: If you would like a different response from the same message, changing the seed will change the response. A null value generates a random seed.

temperature.description: A value between 0.0 and 2.0 that controls the randomness of the model's output. When set closer to 1, such as 0.8, the outcome is more unpredictable and creative. Values nearing 0, like 0.2, produce more predictable and less creative results. Setting temperature to zero is equivalent to setting a seed, enabling deterministic testing.

top_p.description: A value between 0.0 and 1.0 that controls the probability of the model generating a particular token. A higher value will result in more diverse outputs, while a lower value will result in more repetitive outputs.

frequency_penalty.description: A value between -2.0 and 2.0 that controls how much the model penalizes generating repetitive responses.

presence_penalty.description: A value between -2.0 and 2.0 that controls how much the model penalizes generating responses that contain certain words or phrases.

stop.description: A list of strings that the model will stop generating text if it encounters any of them.

logprobs.description: Whether to return log probabilities of the output tokens or not. If true, returns the log probabilities of each output token returned in the content of message.

top_logprobs.description: An integer between 0 and 20 specifying the number of most likely tokens to return at each token position, each with an associated log probability. `logprobs` must be set to true if this parameter is used.

oneOf.description: Specify which (if any) tool is called by the model. `none` means the model will not call any tool and instead generates a message. `auto` means the model can pick between generating a message or calling one or more tools. `required` means the model must call one or more tools. Specifying a particular tool via `{"type": "function", "function": {"name": "my_function"}}` forces the model to call that tool.

mode.description: Constrains the tools available to the model to a pre-defined set. `auto` allows the model to pick from among the allowed tools and generate a message. `required` requires the model to call one or more of the allowed tools.

tools.description: A list of tool definitions that the model should be allowed to call.
A list of function tools the model may call.

collection.description: The [vector store collection](#operation/list-vector-stores) to search for relevant context.

model.description: The [model](#operation/list-models) that will be inferred for chat completion.

messages.description: The message context to use for the chat completion request, separated by system, user, and assistant roles.

max_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate for the chat completion.

n.description: The number of chat completion choices to generate for each input message.

seed.description: If you would like a different response from the same message, changing the seed will change the response. A null value generates a random seed.

temperature.description: A value between 0.0 and 2.0 that controls the randomness of the model's output. When set closer to 1, such as 0.8, the outcome is more unpredictable and creative. Values nearing 0, like 0.2, produce more predictable and less creative results. Setting temperature to zero is equivalent to setting a seed, enabling deterministic testing.

top_p.description: A value between 0.0 and 1.0 that controls the probability of the model generating a particular token. A higher value will result in more diverse outputs, while a lower value will result in more repetitive outputs.

stop.description: A list of strings that the model will stop generating text if it encounters any of them.

frequency_penalty.description: A value between -2.0 and 2.0 that controls how much the model penalizes generating repetitive responses.

presence_penalty.description: A value between -2.0 and 2.0 that controls how much the model penalizes generating responses that contain certain words or phrases.

stream.description: Indicates whether the response should be streamed.

logprobs.description: Whether to return log probabilities of the output tokens or not. If true, returns the log probabilities of each output token returned in the content of message.

top_logprobs.description: An integer between 0 and 20 specifying the number of most likely tokens to return at each token position, each with an associated log probability. `logprobs` must be set to true if this parameter is used.

oneOf.description: Specify which (if any) tool is called by the model. `none` means the model will not call any tool and instead generates a message. `auto` means the model can pick between generating a message or calling one or more tools. `required` means the model must call one or more tools. Specifying a particular tool via `{"type": "function", "function": {"name": "my_function"}}` forces the model to call that tool.

mode.description: Constrains the tools available to the model to a pre-defined set. `auto` allows the model to pick from among the allowed tools and generate a message. `required` requires the model to call one or more of the allowed tools.

tools.description: A list of tool definitions that the model should be allowed to call.
A list of function tools the model may call.

id.description: A unique identifier for the chat completion.

created.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) of when the chat completion was created.

model.description: The model that was inferred for chat completion.

choices.description: The resulting assistant message(s) for the chat completion.

id.description: A unique identifier for the chat completion.

object.description: The object type, which is always `chat.completion.chunk`.

created.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) of when the chat completion was created.

model.description: The model that was inferred for chat completion.

choices.description: The resulting assistant message(s) for the chat completion.

model.description: The [model](#operation/list-audio-models) that will be used to generate text-to-speech audio.

input.description: The text to generate audio for, up to a maximum of 2,000 characters.

voice.description: The voice that will be used in the generated audio.

collections.description: A list of vector store collections.

name.description: The name of the vector store collection. This is also used to auto-generate a unique ID for the record.
The name of the vector store collection. Note: the previously generated unique ID will remain the same.

vector-store-collection.title: Vector Store Collection
vector-store-collection.description: An object representing a vector store collection containing embeddings records.

id.description: The unique ID of the vector store collection.

name.description: The name of the vector store collection.

created.description: The UTC creation timestamp of the vector store collection in ISO 8601 format.

input.description: The text query to search against the embeddings items in the vector store collection.

results.description: A list of collection items that best match the embeddings search query, sorted by most relevant first.

vector-store-search-result.title: Vector Store Collection
vector-store-search-result.description: An object representing a collection item search result.

id.description: The unique ID of the vector store collection item.

created.description: The UTC creation timestamp of the collection item in ISO 8601 format.

content.description: The readable content text of the vector store collection item.

list-vector-store-items-response-payload.title: List Vector Store Items Response Payload
list-vector-store-items-response-payload.description: List Vector Store Items Response Payload

items.description: A list of vector store collection items.

add-vector-store-item-request-payload.title: Add Vector Store Item Request Payload
add-vector-store-item-request-payload.description: Add Vector Store Item Request Payload

content.description: The text to be converted into embeddings and stored in the vector store collection.

description.description: A description of the contents in this collection item record. If omitted, this value will default to a shortened version of the text stored in the collection.

auto_chunk.description: Indicates whether the system will automatically chunk the content if it exceeds the embeddings model's maximum sequence length. If set to true, the content will be split into 300 token chunks with 20 tokens of overlap before and after each piece.

add-vector-store-item-response-payload.title: Add Vector Store Item Response Payload
add-vector-store-item-response-payload.description: Add Vector Store Item Response Payload

add-vector-store-item-chunked-response-p.title: Add Vector Store Item Chunked Response Payload
add-vector-store-item-chunked-response-p.description: Add Vector Store Item Chunked Response Payload

items.description: A list of vector store collection items for the chunked content.

update-vector-store-item-request-payload.title: Update Vector Store Item Request Payload
update-vector-store-item-request-payload.description: Update Vector Store Item Request Payload

description.description: A description of the contents in this collection item record.

get-vector-store-item-response-payload.title: Get Vector Store Item Response Payload
get-vector-store-item-response-payload.description: Get Vector Store Item Response Payload

vector-store-item.title: Vector Store Collection Item List
vector-store-item.description: An object representing an embeddings record within a vector store collection item list.

id.description: The unique ID of the vector store collection item.

created.description: The UTC creation timestamp of the collection item in ISO 8601 format.

description.description: The short description of the content stored as embeddings for this record.

vector-store-item-full.title: Vector Store Collection Item
vector-store-item-full.description: An object representing an embeddings record within a vector store collection.

id.description: The unique ID of the vector store collection item.

created.description: The UTC creation timestamp of the collection item in ISO 8601 format.

description.description: The short description of the content stored as embeddings for this record.

content.description: The full text of the content stored as embeddings for this record.

list-vector-store-files-response-payload.title: List Vector Store Files Response Payload
list-vector-store-files-response-payload.description: List Vector Store Files Response Payload

files.description: A list of vector store collection items.

add-vector-store-file-response-payload.title: Add Vector Store File Response Payload
add-vector-store-file-response-payload.description: Add Vector Store File Response Payload

get-vector-store-file-response-payload.title: Get Vector Store File Response Payload
get-vector-store-file-response-payload.description: Get Vector Store File Response Payload

vector-store-file.title: Vector Store Collection File
vector-store-file.description: An object representing a file uploaded to a vector store collection.

id.description: The unique ID of the vector store collection file.

filename.description: The name and extension of the file added to the vector store collection.

status.description: The current processing status of the vector store collection file.

error.description: The description of what error was reached while processing the file for `error` status only.

items.description: The number of embeddings records representing the file in the vector store collection. Omitted for `error` status.

tokens.description: The number of tokens used while processing the uploaded file. Omitted for `error` status.

object.description: The type of object represented in the response, which is always `list`.

data.description: A list of publicly-available models for use in inference.

id.description: The unique model identifier that can be used in inference API endpoints.

created.description: The Unix timestamp of when the model was added to the inference API.

object.description: The type of object represented in the response, which is always `model`.

owned_by.description: The organization that owns the model.

features.description: A list of features supported by the model.

speech.description: A list of models for use in text-to-speech inference.

bark.description: A list of voices to use for Bark model speech generation.

xtts.description: A list of voices to use for XTTS model speech generation.

models.description: A list of models for use in image generation.

chat-completion-usage.title: Chat Completion Usage
chat-completion-usage.description: An object containing usage information for this request.

completion_tokens.description: Number of tokens in the generated completion.

prompt_tokens.description: Number of tokens in the prompt. Includes vector search embeddings tokens for RAG requests.

total_tokens.description: Total number of tokens used in the request (prompt + completion).

embeddings-usage.title: Embeddings Usage
embeddings-usage.description: An object containing usage information for this embeddings request.

prompt_tokens.description: Number of tokens in the provided input.

total_tokens.description: Total number of tokens used in the request.

index.description: The index of the choice in the list of choices.

finish_reason.description: The reason the model stopped generating tokens. This will be 'stop' if the model hit a natural stop point or a provided stop sequence or 'length' if the maximum number of tokens specified in the request was reached.

index.description: The index of the choice in the list of choices.

finish_reason.description: The reason the model stopped generating tokens. This will be 'stop' if the model hit a natural stop point or a provided stop sequence or 'length' if the maximum number of tokens specified in the request was reached.

chat-completion-req-message.title: Chat Completion Request Message
chat-completion-req-message.description: An object containing the role and content for a chat completion request message.

role.description: The role of the author of this message.

chat-completion-message.title: Chat Completion Message
chat-completion-message.description: An object containing the role and content for a chat completion message.

role.description: The role of the author of this message.

tool_calls.description: The tool calls generated by the model, such as function calls.

chat-completion-stream-message.title: Chat Completion Stream Message
chat-completion-stream-message.description: An object containing the role and content for a chat completion stream message.

role.description: The role of the author of this message.

chat-completion-logprobs.title: Chat Completion Logprobs
chat-completion-logprobs.description: An object containing the log probability information for a chat completion choice.

content.description: A list of message content tokens with log probability information.

logprobs-message-content-tokens.title: Chat Completion Logprobs Message Content Tokens
logprobs-message-content-tokens.description: An object containing message content tokens for a chat completion choice log probability information.

token.description: The text content of the token.

logprob.description: The log probability of the token.

bytes.description: A list of integers representing the UTF-8 bytes representation of the token.

top_logprobs.description: List of the most likely tokens and their log probability, at this token position.

logprobs-message-content-token.title: Chat Completion Logprobs Message Content Token
logprobs-message-content-token.description: An object containing a message content token for a chat completion choice log probability information.

token.description: The text content of the token.

logprob.description: The log probability of the token.

bytes.description: A list of integers representing the UTF-8 bytes representation of the token.

message-tool-calls.title: Chat Completion Message Tool Calls
message-tool-calls.description: An object containing the tool calls generated by the model for a chat completion choice.

id.description: The ID of the tool call.

type.description: The type of the tool. Currently, only `function` is supported.

tool-call-function.title: Chat Completion Tool Call Function
tool-call-function.description: An object containing the the function that the model called for a chat completion choice.

name.description: The name of the function to call.

arguments.description: The arguments to call the function with, as generated by the model in JSON format.

function-tool.title: Chat Completion Function Tool
function-tool.description: A function tool that can be used to generate a response.

type.description: The type of the tool. Currently, only `function` is supported.

tool-function.title: Chat Completion Tool Function
tool-function.description: An object representing a function for use with chat completion tool calling.

name.description: The name of the function to be called. Must be a-z, A-Z, 0-9, or contain underscores and dashes, with a maximum length of 64

description.description: A description of what the function does, used by the model to choose when and how to call the function.

parameters.description: The parameters the functions accepts, described as a JSON Schema object.

strict.description: Whether to enable strict schema adherence when generating the function call. If set to true, the model will follow the exact schema defined in the `parameters` field. Only a subset of JSON Schema is supported when `strict` is `true`.

function-tool-choice.title: Chat Completion Function Tool Choice
function-tool-choice.description: Specifies a tool the model should use. Use to force the model to call a specific function..

type.description: For function calling, the type is always `function`.

name.description: The name of the function to call.

id.description: The unique model identifier that can be used in inference API endpoints.

created.description: The Unix timestamp of when the model was added to the inference API.

object.description: The type of object represented in the response, which is always `model`.

owned_by.description: The organization that owns the model.

features.description: A list of features supported by the model.

id.description: The unique model identifier that can be used in inference API endpoints.

created.description: The Unix timestamp of when the model was added to the inference API.

price.description: The price per 1000 input characters for using the model.

id.description: The unique model identifier that can be used in inference API endpoints.

created.description: The Unix timestamp of when the model was added to the inference API.

price.description: The price per megapixel for using the model.

usage-object.title: Inference Usage
usage-object.description: Object containing usage values for the given month.

chat.description: The total number of chat completion tokens used in this monthly period.

tts.description: The total number of text-to-speech input characters used this period with the standard HD model.

tts_sm.description: The total number of text-to-speech input characters used this period with the basic model.

image.description: The total number of megapixels generated during this period with a standard model.

image_sm.description: The total number of megapixels generated during this period with a small model.

cluster-status-response-payload.title: Health Check Get Cluster Status Response Payload
cluster-status-response-payload.description: Health Check Get Cluster Status Response Payload

status.description: The current status of the inference cluster.

cluster-status-response-error-payload.title: Health Check Get Cluster Status Error Response Payload
cluster-status-response-error-payload.description: Health Check Get Cluster Status Error Response Payload

status.description: The current status of the inference cluster.

message.description: A more detailed error message regarding why the health check failed.

timestamp.description: The UTC timestamp of the logged request in ISO 8601 format.

method.description: The method used for the logged request call, e.g. `GET`, `POST`, etc.

endpoint.description: The API endpoint called in the logged request.

request_headers.description: A string containing the logged request's request headers in JSON format, with private information such as the API key redacted.

request_body.description: A string containing the logged request's body in JSON format, or an empty string if no request body was sent.

response_body.description: A string containing the logged request's response body in JSON format, or an empty string if no response body was returned. Media content responses will return a placeholder message.

response_code.description: The HTTP response status code returned when the logged request was made.

period.description: The number of minutes to search back from the chosen timestamp, up to the previous hour.

timestamp.description: The UTC timestamp to search request logs from in ISO 8601 format, e.g. `2024-01-01T12:00:00Z`. Omit to default to the current UTC time.

endpoint.description: The name of the endpoint to narrow your request search.

b64_json.description: The base64-encoded JSON of the generated image. Only present if `response_format` is set to `b64_json`.

url.description: The URL of the generated image if `response_format` is set to `url` (default value). Expires after one hour.

prompt.description: A text description of the desired image(s). The maximum length is 2000 characters.

model.description: The model to use for image generation. Defaults to `flux.1-dev`.

n.description: The number of images to generate. Must be between 1 and 10.

response_format.description: The format in which generated images are returned. Must be one of `url` or `b64_json`.

size.description: The size of the generated images. Must be one of `256x256`, `512x512`, `1024x1024` (default value), `1792x1024`, and `1024x1792`.

created.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) of when the image was created.

chat-completion-id.name: id
chat-completion-id.description: The ID of the chat completion job.

vector-store-id.name: id
vector-store-id.description: The ID of the vector store collection.

vector-store-item-id.name: itemid
vector-store-item-id.description: The ID of the vector store collection item.

vector-store-file-id.name: fileid
vector-store-file-id.description: The ID of the vector store collection file.

model-id.name: id
model-id.description: The ID of the inference model.

API Key.description:
The Vultr Inference API v1 uses API keys for authentication. You can manage your API keys in the Vultr customer portal. Please do not share API keys publicly, or embed them in client-side code.

To authenticate a request, send your API Key as a bearer token in the request header.

### Authentication Example

    curl "https://api.vultrinference.com/v1/models" \
      -X GET \
      -H "Authorization: Bearer ${VULTR_API_KEY}"

Unauthenticated API requests will fail. All requests must use HTTPS encryption for security, and calls made with HTTP will fail.
